website_summaries.verdict: One of the few liquid cooling systems to sport a 3-fan radiator design for maximum cooling.
pros: Large 360-millimeter radiator features three individual fans pulling air in to cool the circulating liquid
RGB lights can be controlled from voice and iOS or Android devices
cons: Larger radiator may not fit in some small or cramped PC cases

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase
customer_reviews.text: This might be the BEST bang for your buck. If you are into overclocking this is definitely a must buy product. I had the evo 212 and I would overclock my i7-4790k to 4.5mhz/ 1.23v and the temp would range between 68c to 80c. Now, my temperature don't even get past 60c at full load when idle it hits as low as 27c. I didn't go with the corsair for two reason, price and I've had a bad experience with their H100i. The installation is quite simple, it does come with a installation guide, which is very helpful even for beginners. The only bad thing I can say about this product is the logo on it, looks a bit unattractive.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Beware does not honer stated 3-year warranty
customer_reviews.text: I liked the performance and the price. Don't like that the product has quit working and they don't honor their 3-year warranty stated here on the site.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin66

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my CPU cool, and allows me to overclock very well
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my CPU cool, and allows me to overclock very well. Running a 2011-3 i7 5820k got it pushed to 4.0 with my RAM overclocked too. With the RAM set to it's default speed, I was able to push the CPU itself to 4.4 with a voltage of 1.34V 46*C. I turned the multiplier down due to the instability when I overclocked my RAM, got everything locked and stable at 4.0 1.29V and ram to 3200. CPU running at 41*C PS; Absolutely no difference in temp with fans on top blowing in, did both ways, no difference personally. I like my lights :P
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and works great... but no TR4 instructions
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooling system after the piece of junk Enermax cooling system I bought failed within 3 months. This system is extremely quiet and does a great job cooling my AMD Threadripper 1950x. This system does work for socket TR4 processors, but there is no documentation in the box or on the web for the install. For the TR4 install, you will need the cooling adapter that comes in the Threadripper box. Once you figure this out, the install is easy. Some documentation would have saved me an hour trying to figure this out.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Install Issue
customer_reviews.text: Lack of detailed installation instruction. I'm still unable to configure the fan controller software. Throws error unable to find controller. Where do I plug the power. Attached two photos of the power and the motherboard usb port I was putting it into. It does not fit there and when I force the PC would shut off on power on. 01-10-19 Finally got the Fan Controller replacement from Thermaltake and it worked right away. Great product if it weren't for the fan controller issue during first install.
customer_reviews.author: Jejay

customer_reviews.title: Kids really love the computer components that produce a rainbow of colors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this CPU cooler for my youngest Autistic son and he loves the rainbow of colors it puts out. Kids really love the computer components that produce a rainbow of colors. His keyboard, case, motherboard, and cooler now put out allot of flashy colors, he just like them all. I cannot answer for normal children, teenagers, and young adults but, my disabled son really likes his new computer setup.
customer_reviews.author: Carl O Akers

customer_reviews.title: Effective AIO with RGB.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 positive and 2 negative things to mention in this review about the TT Floe RGB 280 AIO. The construction and material workmanship leave nothing to be desired, just outstanding. Nearly all of the cables have a premium rubber coated sleeve for protection against abrasion. And the rubber hoses between the pump and rad are sleeved with quality braiding. Fans and pump are quiet, effective as well keeping my FX6300 at 18c idle/ 34c maxed. This is the same result achieved using a Hyper212 Evo air cooler. Two annoyances. Fans use proprietary connectors that resemble usb2 headers. The software to control everything is lacking refinement, compared to Corsair's implementation anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A.

customer_reviews.title: Good Performance but Dependence on Your PC case.
customer_reviews.text: I get this Thermaltake Water 3.0 Extreme S cooler for replacing Cooler Master 212 EVO. I am using i7-3960X with OverClock 6 cores to 4.7 Ghz. In the stress test,CPU was thermal throttling due to high temperature by 212 EVO. After I replaced the Water 3.0 Extreme S, the thermal throttling still happen. I have to remove the dust mesh on the front panel and let air pass it easier. Another thing is because CPU heat blow out of the case, no more heat recycle in the case. One thing I don't like is the cooler does not include enough screws for PUSH and PULL fan setup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you want full rgb and 360mm radiator it's pretty much the only option short of full custom.
customer_reviews.text: Cooler works well, and looks great. Had to replace my first one though which came with a defective lighting controller and a pump that made a grinding noise. Pros: easy to use, cools well, looks great. Cons: molex connector for power in 2018? Fins get banged up during shipping. Not adequate protection. Was the same on the first one I got too. Speaking of which, the first one I purchased was super defective. Made a grinding noise when running and the lighting controller didnt work. Update: Second unit now, has gone out after 5 months. Makes a loud buzzing sound while on. Like, a super loud. Trying to get it replaced, but it's out of the amazon return period. >_<
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install (with youtube)
customer_reviews.text: This is the first AIO or water cooling cooler I have ever used. Have always been air prior. But wanted something quiet and with more OC potential. This is paired with the MSI Gaming Pro Carbon and Corsair 678c case. It is nearly dead silent at idol. And even at max fan speed (Blender renders) is barely audible. The stock directions (you can d/load the PDF from thermaltake's website) are adequate. Just a PDF with pics and a few instructions. Watched a few youtube videos prior to installing, and really didn't have any problems / issues at all. I personally don't like or need the RGB features, so turned them off :) Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Cousin

customer_reviews.title: Dont use the factory thermal paste.
customer_reviews.text: Factory paste is garbage. Other wise this keeps my ryzen 2700x at 85c at 4.4 ghz @ 1.48 v. Its a bit on the hot side but i really should be running this cpu on a loop instead of an aio. Over all i found that @ 4 ghz @ 1.3v this will keep you around 83c after a 2 hour stress test. This will keep your cpu pretty cool. caveat I've got 6x 120mm fans attached to the radiator hooked to a controller to keep them in sync.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product is garbage! This is my third one and 2 fans came in broke/defective. One the cable cover was already tore at the base and the other fan had to be defective from the factory. It doesn’t spin freely and will only power to 950-1000 rpms where the other two are doing 1620. The first one I had the rgb on the pump was broke, the second one didn’t come with washers so the radiator punctuated and now this with the third one. For the price there is way better in terms of AIO. The x72 or Corsair will be my next move. Safe yourself a headache and trip to UPS, stay clear of this.
customer_reviews.author: Steven_escalera

customer_reviews.title: Hardware works great - Software needs UX update and better Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Mounted in an open, glass front case (TT Core P5) Likes: Easy mounting and worked first time, pre-applied thermal paste is doing fine RGB LED lights are smooth and look great, and are *very* quiet Materials look smooth and well finished in a glass fronted case Dislikes: Software gives errors that stop Windows from shutting down until you configure the water block LED and disable the unused connector. Unforgivable. This needs to be documented. Summary: Even in an open sided case this AIO solution is whisper quiet and the LEDs are smooth and animate nicely. Temperatures on my admittedly mid-range setup are smoothly held and kept low. The software can use documentation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TH120 and TH240 software control without RGB motherboards.
customer_reviews.text: The TH120 and TH240 come with cables for use with RGB-compatible motherboards and a very basic three-button controller for use without. The controller is quite limited in terms of effects and color options and requires installation somewhere you can actually get to it. If you lack an RGB-compatible motherboard or dislike the proprietary RGB software your motherboard uses, it's possible to use the provided "E" motherboard cable with standalone 5V RGB controllers like the ROG Terminal or Zalman Z-SYNC, providing software control via a much more common USB header.
customer_reviews.author: T.Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Silent. Leds are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I researched to death cpu coolers. Went with this and absolutely love it. Easy to install. Whisper quiet with i7 8700k. I am extremely noise sensitive. You just don't hear this at all. Leds are awesome. If you have pump noise make sure motherboard isn't changing power if pump port. Keep it consistent snout 75 pct and you won't hear it 2 feet away. Only complaint is tubing too short for thermaltake logo to not be upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Ratner

customer_reviews.title: "Coolest" thing I ever put in a computer!  Lots of extra wiring, be prepared.
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the "coolest" thing I've ever put in a computer. Coolest... get it? Seriously, when I first turned it on I was very impressed with how awesome it appear to be. That being said, the only major con is the tremendous amount of extra wiring it comes with. I think it adds about five feet of wires to the rig (conservatively) and I just wasn't prepared for that, not taking away any stars for it though. I haven't tested out if it really is more effective than other similar cooling units.
customer_reviews.author: MaddsPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Excellent AIO for your CPU.
customer_reviews.text: Likes RGB Easy Install Quality Sound Cooling Dislikes None Overall This is an excellent AIO cooler for your CPU. It is very high quality and the RGB also integrates with Razer Synapse so I can control all the lighting in my case with one interface. I don't overclock but this keeps my CPU plenty cool and I have ran it at length without issue.
customer_reviews.author: TWISM

customer_reviews.title: Replacing a older 2.0 Thermaltake
customer_reviews.text: I had a older 2.0 Thermaltake that has done a good job for last 7 years cooling my chip. I started noticing a little higher temps and some freeze up during gaming. I was glad they still making the closed loop, it saved me some time. I was able to leave the old back plate on. Also the new radiator was slimmer and fit in with no problems. My only complaint was the screws, color coding them might be a better way;they kind look the same. It's keeping my xeon chip around 24c-27c.
customer_reviews.author: P. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Mmm RGBgasm
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install (depending on your setup difficulty will vary, but it's more time consuming stuff than actually difficult stuff). RGB galore. And, oh yeah, my PC is cool as ice. My 2080 super almost never passes 60c even on full load, impressive. It is a 'tad' loud but probably hardly any louder than your current cooler so...definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, acceptable performance and tons of RGB features
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase, can't wait to get it to install. The material quality is very good with a sturdy build quality. Cooling Performance is good but not worth the price. Tons of RGB lighting effects but the lights could be more diffused. The software is a little tricky to begin with but once you use it for a while you get use to it. Installation requires a dedicated usb 2.0 port on the motherboard and installation is complex.
customer_reviews.author: Evans Young

customer_reviews.title: Still working great after nearly a year.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for an AM3+ system and it works very well. With the stock heatsink and fan, temperatures were reaching 62C under a 40% load, so I decided to take the plunge and try liquid cooling. With this kit, the CPU only reached 45C with a sustained 100% load. It is easy to install and comes with thermal compound already applied. There is included hardware for both Intel and AMD boards. My only complaint is that the mounting hardware feels like it might be easy to break, so be careful when installing. Also, I had to make a small modification to my Cooler Master HAF 912 case to get it to fit. Other than that, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W

customer_reviews.title: Fans first, remember this,
customer_reviews.text: Only water cooler that could fit a FM2+ board, came with fans, various mounts(back mounts and some socket mounts, I don’t really know what they are called but it was my first pc build, and installed it after a very short amount of time just under a day!) Easy to install as I’m a “first timer” when it comes to pc building, I installed crooked but the adjustable pipes made it so much easier on people like me, INSTALL FANS FIRST NO MATTER WHAT! I learned that through experience that it is super hard to align after it’s mounted. Great product, great price and great experience for everyone into pc’s!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great vga cooler
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my msi Duke gtx 1080 @2100mhz on the core 42c max temp. With stock cooler, max core temp was 78c Using kraken g12 bracket Highly recommend for g12 bracket VGA cooling, much cheaper than others for great performance.
customer_reviews.author: joshua gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Good fans and cooler. Very buggy software to control LEDs on fans.
customer_reviews.text: The cooling system works quite well (so far after only a week) and the fans are fairly quiet. My main gripe is that the software that controls the LED colors on the fans seems to be quite buggy. It's a shame that such good hardware could be coupled with poor quality software. Also, it would have been nice if they had included more that exactly 12 long screws to attach the fans to the radiator. During installation one fell into my computer and I couldn't find it anymore. Also I mounted three fans on both sides of the radiator and so needed a few more long screws.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Go with another brand
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting alot better product for the price. Right out of the box some parts of the radiator was damaged, as well some of the screws didnt work because the hole on the radiator was pressed in a d couldn't grab the thread. Not to mention the stickers on one of the fans was off, not centered so that is extremely obvious. Last but not least, the rgb does not have a smooth transition with the colors or locations around the fan, more like a clock second hand going around a clock.
customer_reviews.author: Knightfire5513

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For my Ryzen 7 2700X
customer_reviews.text: Even though the Stock Prism air cooler that came with my Ryzen 2700X is bar far the best stock air cooler I have ever used, this AIO was worth the upgrade!! Temperatures under full load with Prime95 are 5-8 degrees cooler and "normal loads" like games as well as idle are all about 10 degrees cooler and MUCH Quieter. The looks and lights are superb!! My only complaint would be the software to control the lighting is buggy, but it does work...
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Overall, Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Some of the fins on the rad did show up slightly dinged. But they are EASY to straighten out. (I agree that you shouldn't have to do that for the price, but is an easy fix either way) The performance is there, the looks are there, the flash is there. I would only like to see the software mature a little more, and have a few more features like reversing the lighting direction when it goes around the fans. As well as cool options like going in series from front to back and so on. Other than that, buy it already.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon

customer_reviews.title: Brillliant cooler that handles my OCed 9900k without issues
customer_reviews.text: So it takes care of my 9900k at 5Ghz all cores without issues and that is all I wanted. Looks fantastic as well. Even at high speed the fans have little noise. The main issue I found was the tubing length. It is WAY too short so installing in the front of the case is a no no for most cases. With a more normal tubing size this would be a perfect 10.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gabriel G.

customer_reviews.title: Hoses are too short for really big cases unless you rotate the MB
customer_reviews.text: I have another of these TT AIO coolers and it works very well, just like the small picture. Unfortunately I got a bigger case for my new system, a TT Core P5 T6. This is an open case and has a very nice mounting in the front just like the smaller one shown for the radiator. But the T6 has two more inches between the MB and radiator in case you want to do a custom cooler setup and put the waterpump/reservoir there. This makes the hoses on the 360 too short to reach the CPU with the MB in the normal position. Note the second picture, the MB is rotated 90 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Colorful but the easy part is putting it on the cpu.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice and compact radiator and easy easy installation to cpu mount. The set up for the rgb part was very annoying to work around in my case. I didn’t want the rgb part of this cooler, but you can’t make it normal without extra fans that aren’t the ones in the case. The rgb does have a ton of lighting options though.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Yoders

customer_reviews.title: Wasted so much time.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received was open and missing parts. (Amazons fault) The second one had a bad fan controller. Called Thermaltake and had to wait for them to send a new fan controller. New fan controller was bad also. Got pissed and asked for a refund, then bought the Corsair H100i RGB Pro. Thermaltake has some great products, but not this. Buy the Corsair H100i.
customer_reviews.author: Dirt7

customer_reviews.title: Giving Thermaltake the benefit of the doubt worked out great
customer_reviews.text: My first one had pump issues, could hear the grinding as soon as it powered on. I really like Thermaltake and have had some amazing longevity out of some of their products (note: this was before they changed hands but I heard they tried to maintain the high standards). The second one is working perfectly and looks great. RGB has lots of options and install was EZ. Definitely measure twice and check your dimensions for good fit, It's on the big side.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Colorful, cooling
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The right Kit to use with Thermaltak T3, as any large cooling kits, will not fit them, due to a lack of walls etc on the case. This one is easy to add, and looks just great. Cons: One observation that I have, al;so first one by my client too, can we see the liquid in the tubes :( So I will suggest Thermaltak to make the tubes maybe longer, transparent, and would be killer, if we could add our choice of color dye to it. I know this is why they stayed away from transparent in the first place, but, come on guys, do it
customer_reviews.author: ali

customer_reviews.title: Defective fan almost ruined my whole system
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept and the build of the close looped system seems well done; however, a defective fan shorted out which caused the fan controller to MELT and SMOKE! Thankfully I was paying close attention and immediately shut everything down before it burned up more components. After unplugging the culprit fan which LEDs has burned out, everything works well and the controller did not heat up dangerously again. I plan to replace the fan, as it will be much easier than replacing the whole system, but now the new PC I built isn’t quite as perfect as I had hoped with the defective fan and the melted controller.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Linneman

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but issues with app when moving the window to another monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Cool looking, but I don't see the lights in my rig. Nice little application to manage the lights and speed. The recent update to the software, however causes the window to distort when moving to a lower resolution monitored on the right. It doesn't have the problem going to the left. Their help desk answer was to change a setting in Windows to prevent the scaling differences, but that will cause problems with my work.
customer_reviews.author: Nimrod

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of AMD and Intel CPU has different normal temperature
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my open case and it got an outstanding look. High-quality material and especially I got a good price when I was on sale. The RGB light is a trademark of TT and I love it, it looks like a high-end RGQ fan not a thing like the unbranded one. I used this for my AMD CPU ryzen 7 2700x and keep it with normal temp as 32 degrees which is good to me. The noise may be a bit loud when computer processing something, but it is acceptable noise when idle.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Phan

customer_reviews.title: I personally love this none rgb option as I'm an avid horror ...
customer_reviews.text: Hooked this up to my 8700k. keeps it under 38c in GTA V. Having three fans means I can run them at lower rpm for quiet and still have some room to boost my fans speed when i oc my cpu. I personally love this none rgb option as I'm an avid horror game enthusiast. This keeps my gaming pc Cool and dark while saving me hundreds of dollars on fans. only real con is the cpu block has a horrible design on it... i need to paint over it with something safe ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Alan C.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This AIO was extremely disappointing. After looking at the temperatures I was getting I started getting a little suspicious. I then went ahead and grabbed the fans off my old Corsair 120mm aio and swapped out 2 of the 3. My suspicions were correct, my tempatures dropped 10 degrees C. The fans that come with the Thermaltake AIO are trash, I'm pretty sure they are not even static pressure fans and just regular cfm fans. It will cost you 45$ more to get the correct fans, therefore I would just spend the extra 10-20 dollars and go with a a better AIO instead.
customer_reviews.author: H. Hector

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but efficient
customer_reviews.text: Great radiator and it keeps my i7-9700k nice and cool even when overclocked. The only complaint o have is there is some bubbles and you can hear it every time it goes through the CPU block. With a closed loop, that is to be expected tho. It’s hard to deal a closed loop system without getting any air into it whatsoever.. atleast I imagine it would be. I also got 6 more Thermaltake case fans for my new case (I did some big upgrades) and they all all the fans plug into controls and those controls can be plugged in together making it very easy to control the rgb from the app. I would definitely recommend this rad.
customer_reviews.author: Brantley Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! I received it and was a little worried that I wouldn't be able to install it. Upon installation, it was hitting a couple of heat sinks on the mobo but I removed them and haven't had any trouble with any functions on the mobo and the cooler has kept my cpu running ice cold ever since. I was able to get a stale OC on my ryzen 1600 to 3.85 running around 50c on full load. Usual temps are in the 30's.
customer_reviews.author: Brentley I.

customer_reviews.title: I've had to RMA one of these and experienced a failure of some kind on 2 of them
customer_reviews.text: Performance is great. Look is great. Software is meh. Price is meh. Reliability is absolutely terrible. If you don't want to go through the RMA process at some point or you are looking for a cooler that will last you a while, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Seiffert

customer_reviews.title: Can They Get The Software To Work!
customer_reviews.text: I have a huge problem with these AIO. I have submitted two Tickets to Thermaltake. I will try one last time and call them tomorrow. But the software just does not work whcihc effects everything with the pump and fans. Can’t control anything. I was able to with my Corsair products so it’s not the motherboard or windows issue. I’ve got two replacements from amazon but it’s not fair to them they having to waste shipping cost for a product that is defective. Two are and we’re brand new! I really thought I would love there products but I can’t understand why they would ship out defective products!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Burkett

customer_reviews.title: Great Liquid cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my old liquid cooler. Now that I have this I don't have to listen to loud noises, it's very quiet and works great! I put an extra fan on mine. If you need a simple yet effective liquid cooler but don't want to spend any more then this, well you can't go wrong best one I have seen at this price! The only downside would be the instructions, They're kinda useless. I ended up using Google and guessing lol. However, their customer support was very responsive and answered all questions within minutes. Overall great product!
customer_reviews.author: Vance

customer_reviews.title: Ideal RGB option, horrible lazy software implementation.
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality, everything is very quiet, aio keeps OC'd 9900k at 30c idle, 58c under load. Fan/rgb hub has poor instructions, & isn't compatible with windows 10 sleep mode (RGB settings will not save with sleep mode enabled). Honestly Thermaltake could be the king of PC RGB with their build quality, if only they would just improve their software.
customer_reviews.author: RealMelGibson

customer_reviews.title: All the RGB You Ever Wanted!
customer_reviews.text: The Good: - Very easy to install - Fans are very quiet - Comes with AMD and Intel mounting parts - Comes with good thermal paste pre-applied I replaced it with the more expensive stuff and temps only dropped by 2C The Bad: - The pump can be hear over the fans sometimes - Not a fan of the RGB software it always has to run in the background
customer_reviews.author: R. Colon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooler with great leds.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cooler that keeps everything cool. Everything is of quality and packaged nice. Only problem I had was the dead bug that was shipped with it picture attached. Eww
customer_reviews.author: Rashad Moore

customer_reviews.title: Should have gone Corsair
customer_reviews.text: In the end, wound up using two of the fan controllers that allow me to use the MB aRGB interface... the fans themselves flash to white on some of the leds. I've got an overkill PSU, so it's not that. Would suggest going Corsair or forgoing RGB altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Tracker1

customer_reviews.title: Great cooling then dead pump after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Pump died after 2 weeks. Unreal. Thank God for Amazon's return service. Anyone even thinking about buying this just skip this and get the non-rgb edition because their controller is the worst in the market and their manual is non-existant and VERY VERY misleading. PLEASE WATCH REVIEWS ON YOUTUBE TO REALIZE THAT THE USB CONNECTOR DOESN'T GO WHERE YOU THINK IT GOES.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Riing Plus RGB 280mm
customer_reviews.text: Installed this into the Thermaltake View 71 with a Ryzen 2700x. I top mounted it with the fans above to pull the heat out of the case. Ran several benchmarks and gamed for a few hours CPU never went over 65c. You can hear the pump running but once I closed up the case it wasn't noticeable. The fans are also super quiet and everything links up to Thermaltake's RGB SW. It's easy to install if you have any knowledge building PCs and even if you done just look online and you can find how to videos.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Struble

customer_reviews.title: lights dont wok at all
customer_reviews.text: lights do not work controllers do not work fans are only thing that works contacted tt support 5 times no resolution 5th time the message was sorry we are not open on weekends no mention on other 4 contacts over past 2 weeks 4th time was ignored you can make your own conclusions recommend do not buy
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Better than 2.0 except 1 thing....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my water 2.0 that had failed after 5 years. It's really much nicerr and easier to install. The only problem is there's no USB cable on this one so you can't control the fan speed. It's just always on high but I can deal with that.
customer_reviews.author: David Billings

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Comes with thermal paste pre-applied. Not too difficult to install if you know your way around a PC. The instructions leave a little bit to be desired though. There are a ton of different screws and parts that allow it to be compatible with multiple types of boards and CPUs, but those parts weren't labeled at all. You kind of have to eyeball them to get an idea of which ones to use. This would be 5 stars if they just labeled the hardware bags so it would be easier to identify which pieces to use for which configurations.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Love it, quite and does its job
customer_reviews.text: Once setup its a dream, quite and efficient. Only draw backs are instructions are vague if you have never installed a liquid cooler before, uses a usb 2.0 header on the Mobo (you may need a splitter for case), and powered by a molex connector so you need to ensure your Power supply has a molex cable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Saeler

customer_reviews.title: Color malfunctions after 4 months of usage
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months, the color became distorted and it doesn't seem to respond to the software anymore. Only one quadrant is set to the color I want, the other three seem to be random. I would have made this a 1 star but this thing is keeping my CPU cool at least. However, if I only wanted a CPU cooler without controllable RGB, I would have paid $70 instead of $170. I don't recommend this product if you actually care about the RGB functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Parker

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes at all. This is a awesome cooler. Keeps my i9 9700 at 70 degrees on its 100 percent load at 4.2 gigahertz. I could even overclock to close to 5 gigs with this. Cant hear the pump or the fans and the software is really really good when you learn how to use it. Takes a learning curve to figure it out. But im old so that's how it is.
customer_reviews.author: Polly Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Performs well, radiator fan loud at full speed, Fits in tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: I installed this onto my GPU with an adapter and it performs admirably. Once it gets going, the pump is quiet. Tubes are sufficiently bendy and the nozzles can rotate. I was able to get it into a pretty tight case. The 120mm fan on the radiator is rather loud at full speed, but when it's cooling a very hot-running GPU, it does a good job of dispersing the heat. It was able to keep a ~150W GPU at the low 60s (C) at full load.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad company
customer_reviews.text: RGB lights on pump stopped working correctly after 2 months. RMA the first cooler and they sent me a refurbished cooler with the same issue. Complaints all over their forums about this issue. Will never buy a thermaltake product again.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Urban

customer_reviews.title: good make.
customer_reviews.text: 5 star due to the no questions asked return policy. I wanted to love this item, it is my own fault in the end reading through the comments i swore i seen that in the beginning of March it would start being shipped with A4 brackets for my new Ryzen build it did not have one. I did take my time looking at the items however it looked great the radiator is amazing heavy and strong feeling. the instructions could be worked on a bit but that is not enough for a -1star. i hope i will get to use this in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Figment

customer_reviews.title: RGB
customer_reviews.text: None of the software works correctly very well built but doesn't work correctly not user friendly Contacting them for issues has been nothing but a problem I've spent a lot of money on this TT ring plus product line and have had no luck, Stay away from this headache and save yourself a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Note8

customer_reviews.title: Super Cool Cooler with software issues
customer_reviews.text: Great cooling unit with many bells and whistles, however the LED controller could be better. Had to replace the LED control unit twice and it still doesn't function properly. Cooling unit and fans / LED themselves are flawless, but the software / adjustment tools for the LED is quirky and full of errata, cant find the controller, etc...annoying problem for such an expensive cooler.
customer_reviews.author: F L A S H

customer_reviews.title: RMA the second time, still have pump noise.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2x240mm and 1x360 floe ring. my 360mm has much more loud pump noise compared to 240, i tried all the method to eliminate air bubble, but still doesnt help. It doesnt look premium as EVGA, and the tube length is not enough. But RGB color is very bright and accurate. Low noise fan.
customer_reviews.author: DPN916

customer_reviews.title: Software cost me a CPU.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently the software for this cooler was accurately reading my CPU temp, and told the pump to go ahead and stop running, so my i7 cooked itself to death while the cooler just sat there. The hardware works fine, but software decided to stop cooling a CPU that eventually hit 100 Celsius and stayed there until I got home from work.
customer_reviews.author: Seth D.Yockey

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and cools really well
customer_reviews.text: Using the cooler on a gaming AMD Ryzen 7. Always keeps the CPU cool. The one thing I would wish for is that the cooling lines where 1/2 inch longer. They reach my Ryzen 7 okay, but a little bit of a stretch with the Lian Li PC011 case and Asus ROG STRIX ATX card. I would use this cooler again if I needed to build another PC. Also, looks GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Science

customer_reviews.title: Great cooling.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite AIO cpu cooler ive ever bought. Looks amazing and works just as good. Able to over clock my 2700x to 4.3ghz no problem with it going to 70c at the highest. Had my 6700k overclocked at 4.7ghz with it too.
customer_reviews.author: RSG_COMPANY

customer_reviews.title: Running a flat 30C on Core i7
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, keeps it cool, and doesn't have craptastic Corsair software. I switched to these after two different Corsairs failed on me and their software caused random crashes in my systems. Have never looked back, very happy with the Thermaltake Floe Riing and put one on any computer that needs liquid cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Gold Grenade

customer_reviews.title: Budget option only
customer_reviews.text: Not enough thermal dissipation for my 1080ti, would easily cool an i5 or lower TDP. Not quite enough for me though. Non sleeved tunes and no fancy lighting. Easy to install acetec style pump.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan C.

customer_reviews.title: Wiring not so good, lighting really good.
customer_reviews.text: After a while of getting the "Unable to Find Controller" error code H_0x001 trying the two different software packages and still getting the error I finally chased the problem down to the molex pin connector. Unplugged it made sure all the pins were in line and plugged it back in and finally lit up. So far it is working fine. Looks really good in the P3 case, the main problem with the unit is the wiring connectors, for the price could be way better, also the instructions could show the correct wiring better. Will see how it performs over the next few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: Pump is dying within 2 years and customer service will not reply
customer_reviews.text: Thermaltake's customer support is terrible. Do not buy their products, especially not this one unless you want a pump to die within a year. I've been through their exchange process with a 1200w PSU before and it takes forever. I will no longer buy their products.
customer_reviews.author: Wildcard

customer_reviews.title: Serious compatibility issues.
customer_reviews.text: The software that is required to operate the Thermaltake riing lighting will not work with the hardware I have. the X1 RGB will crash my Vega 56 graphics or the phone app wont find any controller boxes. AMD and Thermaltake Do not marry well. AMD 1900 threadripper Asus strix x399 e Thermaltake Riing Plus 14 RGB TT Premium Edition 140mm x10 Thermaltake Riing 280 RGB AIO Asus Arez Vega 56 x2
customer_reviews.author: polarisjoe

customer_reviews.title: Fan is making a LOT of noise after 1 month 6 days. =(
customer_reviews.text: *update, Thermaltake sent a replacement fan and it seemed to correct the issue. This unit was working well until last night. It started making noise until I put my finger on it to slow the fan down. It stops then starts back up again as soon as I remove my finger. Obviously one of the fan bearings is going out. Kind of sad after less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: CTech LLC

customer_reviews.title: Great AIO cooler with bit of pump noise
customer_reviews.text: Good priced product with quality material. Bought 2 for same kind of pc build. Works well. I love cooking fans with good app. Fan does not make noise but pump make weired noise. One is more than the other one. So it is all by your luck. I may listen more noise because I use open case. Pipes(hoses) between pump(cpu) and cooler(fan) is pretty short. So you need to measure length before installation. That is y I took off one star. But as you use regular case. It is great AOI cooler.
customer_reviews.author: A Kim

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: product works great out of the box. took me some time to figure out what goes where, but its plug n play. dropped my temps under load a whole 10C!!
customer_reviews.author: julio

customer_reviews.title: Good AIO
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and works as advertised keeping my 9900k at around 45c under load. Noise is what is to be expected from a triple fan setup. Software is easy to use and get this running efficiently. Good cooler. I have used corsair in my previous build. It is still going strong, but haven't noticed any glaring differences in performance. Will see what happens when I start to OC.
customer_reviews.author: Kvj72

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler. Poor packaging.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this cooler for about a year and havent really had any issues. Fans are super quiet. No issues with cooling that I've seen. RGB looks beautiful. Only problem I had was the original packaging. Had to get a replacement right out of the box because the radiator fins were bent by the CPU mount. If the manufacture were to redesign their packaging to better seperate the radiator from the mount I'd have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Runs very cool
customer_reviews.text: I had all corsair products for cooling before, and was about to have to buy my 3rd one having this build for 4 years. Just not built to last. This product however has been amazing. You can tell you're getting the quality you're paying for. My PC went from running 65c on my 4790k @ 4.7ghz gaming to 50c max at the same settings. The fans are super quiet, and their software although a little choppy, is easy to setup your lighting however you want. Oh and the lights are super bright if you're into that sort of thing.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Young

customer_reviews.title: Great Product just not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet but not as powerful for one of the few 360mm in the market right now. For $140, it doesn't come with rgb lighting or any lights for that matter or the software to control these fans. It is well constructed however and keeps my overclocked 4690k @4.5ghz @ under 55C under heavy loads (which is actually just 5-6C less than my hypo evo 212 cooler ). i wish it had a stronger pump but then it would be a little louder so there's that. I give 4/5 BUT would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: MadMartigan

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap good cooling for$
customer_reviews.text: Insanely good cooling for the price, if I had one gripe, it'd be the plastic backplate that can be easy to strip out for my amd fx cpu. If u can, pls try to use original backplate from amd motherboard instead of this one. I give 5 stars cuz it's at least as good if not a couple degrees better than corsair h100i v2 at like twenty bucks less. If it were similarly priced to h100i, I'd have given it four stars because of backplate problems but at this price, it's the best for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it's very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Pump isnt overly large or heavy. Detailed manual. Gets the job done. Good product. In comparison to a corsair or nzxt, the tubing could be better but if it was designed to be so and be more flexible, it makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: colors look awesome, cooler is keeping my 1800x at 35 degrees ...
customer_reviews.text: colors look awesome, cooler is keeping my 1800x at 35 degrees at idle, only thing i had an issue with(user error/misunderstanding) is that this is not directly compatible with aura sync, you need a special controller and your board needs the 3PIN addressable RGB header(x470 and above chipset for Asus ROG).
customer_reviews.author: josh samara

customer_reviews.title: I give one star as it was cool product. If the controller is fine
customer_reviews.text: [update] I gave 5 stars now. 1. It is not Thermaltake's issue. It turned out that it is EVGA modular power supply (PSU). The molex cable is a special design and I use other PSU's cable and it is pin compatible. This is BAD molex cable design by EVGA ever. 2. I asked Thermaltkake to support. They shipped new controller without charge me immediately. Thermaltake has excellent service. So I changed to 5 stars. where I can buy the digital light controller? It is broken after one month. The fan didn't run at all plus no light. I give one star as it was cool product. If the controller is fine, I will give 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Had unit for a while now, no issues with fans,pump or radiator so far. My case is large enough this made it really easy for me. I can see a little trouble in tight areas. The tubing is a bit stiffer than some others. Keeps temps more consistent.
customer_reviews.author: spicytwinkie

customer_reviews.title: Quality hardware, software meh
customer_reviews.text: The cooler does what it is supposed to and helps keep my temps low. Only issue is my inability to manually set a RPM instead of an arbitrary percentage in the software Supposedly this will be fixed in the future but for now. -\(o.o)/-
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional cooler!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Running VERY nicely in a P3 case and looks good. We will see how long it holds up! Right now it is easily managing an i7-7700K at 4.8 ghz I might be able to push it to 5.0 with this cooler. I probably wont do that for at least four years, but then we will find out when the performance is needed!
customer_reviews.author: KnitePrince

customer_reviews.title: Great with NZXT G12 on a 2070 Super
customer_reviews.text: This product is silent and cools my EVGA 2070 Super Black perfectly. In an ITX case, it keeps it below 62c with no pump rattle.
customer_reviews.author: D. Worden

customer_reviews.title: Controller is different than ones that come with fans
customer_reviews.text: This may not be a big deal but keep in mind that this controller cannot be daisy-chained with other controllers. The port is missing. I discovered this when I added new fans and another controller. Maybe this is because they always want the AIO to be the last thing in the chain?
customer_reviews.author: Reston Dane

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU cooler
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with my purchase it took a while to install because there are a lot of parts, but the instructions were clear and I got it done . I was thoroughly impressed with the RGB fans and RGB CPU block. Very quite and an awesome edition to my PC.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Way better than I expected. With my stock heat sink on my I5-3570 I was running between 135 and 140 at idle with Artic Circle silver paste. It's now running only about 5 degrees above room temp with normal usage. I ran prime 95 to stress the system for about 1 hour and it never got about 125 degrees. Didn't expect that as it on a single small fan radiator. More than pleased. Very easy to install reasonably for an all in one system.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E Mathes

customer_reviews.title: Love this product! Buy it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: 1yr review(almost) has worked great with keeping my cpu cool. I sometimes(more than often) leave my pc on over night. The colors on the fan and the cooler can be individually controlled
customer_reviews.author: Ti

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck, but be prepared to watch some YouTube videos to understand the install.
customer_reviews.text: I like this cooler, it works and is really quiet. The colors are awesome aswell. Install of the cooler and and was simple, but I didnt like the brain install, maybe some more detailed instructions, some thermaltake brains cannot be linked together, which was irritating. Change the data wire from the brain to the board into a sata cable instead of a usb.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal

customer_reviews.title: Keeps CPU cool, installed in minutes
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, just dismount the old hardware and put this bad boy to work. Keeps my overclocked CPU running at idle temps between 10C and 20C, under synthetic load I pushed about 60C after several minutes. Build quality seems solid, runs super quiet, can't hear it over my case/GPU fans.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Works well, does what I want.
customer_reviews.text: It's a lower end water cooler. It works, it's pretty quiet, it installed easily, doesn't have frivolous RGB and didn't hog my case. It is a bit of a tight fit, so double check your dimensions!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas grogg

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Was very hard to fit in my case because of my MB (MSI X99 Krait) because it has something that sticks out quite far at the top, but I managed. It works very well, my CPU never even reaches 40C while rendering a scene in 3ds Max (when it's at 100% utility). It also looks great in my black/white rig. The only problem I have is that the screw holes for the radiator gills didn't line up with the case, so I had to improvise. Which was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Tectix

customer_reviews.title: It's big
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any other coolers to compare it with. Also, in my case (phanteks P400) I can only install 2 of the 3 fans due to space. It keeps the i5-8600K OC to 5.25GHz at 74c running any CPU benchmark. It looks OK(I got the non RGB unit.)
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Solved my problem. Next time I'll build a machine with a case that will support a 2 or 3 fan cooler, just to keep the temp in control.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Software

customer_reviews.title: Thermaltake water 3.0
customer_reviews.text: Most likely the best liquid cooler you can buy for the price. At first I was a little hesitant because I never installed a liquid cooler before, but it was a lot easier than I thought. The instructions it came with were very detailed and easy to follow. The product itself is great works very well on keeping you're sytem cool. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kaminski

customer_reviews.title: TT is the best.
customer_reviews.text: This things gorgeous. I put it inside a View 37 and Everytime I have someone over it gets compliments. Now it's loud but I'm running performance mode. If you use the app to set it to silent mode you won't even hear it. No bubble noises like I had seen in some reviews. RGB options for days and really keeps my CPU temps managed under stress load at 4ghz OC on a 3.4 GHz CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for what you gwt
customer_reviews.text: Cheap. 9900k with 2% load would not drop below 48c. Gaming, 80c+ after 10 mins! This could have just been the one I got, but I took a chance and got screwed
customer_reviews.author: David Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying Temperatures
customer_reviews.text: This cooler was purchased as a CPU cooler for a mini-ITX build I was working on. This is the first water-cooling product I have ever purchased and have been pleased with the results. I replaced the stock fans with two noctua NF-F12s. All I hear is the liquid flowing through the tubes when I turn the computer on. No exaggeration. Although I'm still somewhat apprehensive about liquids running through the inside of my computer and may not ever buy another water-cooling product, I am really satisfied with this cooler!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and easy to install "All In One" liquid cooler
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to install (if you read the instructions). Take your time, assemble the pieces, and this cooler will serve you well. I contacted Thermaltake and got confirmation that this cooler needs no extra drivers or software, and it's completely sealed and should never need additional cooling fluid added. This cooler keeps my i7-6700K processor very cool (less than 40 degrees C), even under load. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good CPU cooler
customer_reviews.text: I have had no issues with this except getting it to fit my case. Since it is all self contained you can't remove the hoses to feed through pre-drilled cooling holes. I found a place though and it has performed well. Since everyone was out of stock with the colored fans one I just bought this and the fans separately and it was the same thing for about the same price!
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

product_meta.title: Thermaltake Floe Triple Riing RGB 360 TT Premium Edition PWM TR4 AM4 LGA1200 Ready AIO Liquid Cooling System 360mm CL-W158-PL12SW-A
product_meta.description: Size:360mm| Style:FloeIntroducing the Floe AIO Ring RGB 360 TT Premium Edition, the world's first 16.8 million color liquid CPU cooler with three 120mm Ring Plus RGB fans and RGB LED water block. Go with the floe for today's CPU cooling demands to provide extraordinary performance and superior quality. Supporting a 360mm Radiator space design combined with the Ring Plus 120mm fans and matching RGB LED pump, take color customization to the next level with multiple modes and 12 individual addressable LED controlled via software from your PC to your mobile device. Enjoy better cooling performance with greater CPU protection and go with the floe! 3 year warranty. • Radiator: Dimension:393 x 120 x 27 mm • Compatibility: Intel LGA 2066/2011-3/2011/1366/1200/1156/1155/1151/1150, AMD TR4/AM4/FM2/FM1/AM3+/AM3/AM2+/AM2, *AIO Cooler bracket adapter comes in the AMD Threadripper CPU box. • Water Block: Material:Copper • Pump Rated Voltage:12 V/ 5V • Rated Current:0.325 A / 0.4A • Motor Speed:3600 R.P.M • Fan Dimension:120 x 120 x 25 mm • Speed:500~1400RPM • Noise Level:19.8 ~ 24.7 dB-A • Rated Voltage:12 V • Max. Air Flow:14.2~42.34 CFM • Max. Pressure:0.17~1.54 mm-H2O • Connector:5 pin • Tube: Length:326 mm • Material:Rubber • Weight: 1610g
feature_bullets: Patented Ring Plus RGB Software Enabled : Changes the light modes, colors, speeds, brightness, fan speeds, and even supports AI voice control in iOS and Android devices
12 Separately Controlled RGB LEDs for unrivaled Lighting Control.Rated Voltage:12 V/ 5VRated Current:0.325 A / 0.4AMotor Speed:3600 R.P.M

360mm High Efficiency Radiator with Push/Pull Mounting Support.For desktop:Requires TT RGB PLUS Software 1.1.5 version or later,For iOS:Requires iOS 10.0 or later,For Android:Requires Android 6.0.0 or later with screen resolution 1920 x 1080
High Performance Waterblock and Durable Sleeved Cable
Features RGB of Speed: 500~1400RPM , Noise Level :19.8 ~ 24.7 dB , Rated Voltage:12 V Max
Air Flow:14.2~42.34 CFM , Max. Pressure: 0.17~1.54 millimeter H2O
Tt LCS Certified: Liquid Cooling Supported. Compatible with extreme liquid cooling configurations

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,333 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
